author: Lippus, Pärtel
fulltext:
oai:oai.datacite.org:14066265;2019-04-22T17:25:41Z;ESTDOI;ESTDOI.KEEL;Pikad sõnad;Long words in Estonian;Lippus, Pärtel;Center of Estonian Language Resources;2018;Issued: 2018-01-26;Updated: 2018-01-26;doi:10.15155/1-00-0000-0000-0000-0014CL;Abstract;140 eri silbistruktuuriga 4-6 silbilist sõna. Salvestatud sõnaloendina 2 keelejuhilt ning raamlauses 6 Võru ja 7 Saaremaa keelejuhilt.
40 lühikeste lahtiste silpidega 5-6 silbilist sõna. Salvestatud raamlauses 6 ühiskeelselt keelejuhilt.

Materjali on kasutatud siin:
Pajusalu, K., Help, T., Lippus, P., Niit, E., Teras, P., & Viitso, T.-R. (2005). On the temporal structure of Estonian secondary-stressed feet. Linguistica Uralica, 41(2), 98–106.
Lippus, P., Pajusalu, K., & Teras, P. (2006). The Temporal Structure of Penta- and Hexasyllabic Words in Estonian. In R. Hoffmann & H. Mixdorff (Eds.), Proceedings of the 3rd International Conference Speech Prosody (pp. 759–762). Dresden: TUDpress. Retrieved from http://www.isca-speech.org/archive/sp2006/papers/sp06_103.pdf
;Abstract;A list of 140 words with 4-6 syllables with different syllable structure. Read by 2 speakers in word list and by 6 Võru dialect speakers and 7 Saaremaa dialect speakers in carrier sentences.
A list of 40 words with 5-6 syllables with short open syllables. Read by 6 Standard Estonian speakers in carrier sentences.

The data was collected for:
Pajusalu, K., Help, T., Lippus, P., Niit, E., Teras, P., & Viitso, T.-R. (2005). On the temporal structure of Estonian secondary-stressed feet. Linguistica Uralica, 41(2), 98–106.
Lippus, P., Pajusalu, K., & Teras, P. (2006). The Temporal Structure of Penta- and Hexasyllabic Words in Estonian. In R. Hoffmann & H. Mixdorff (Eds.), Proceedings of the 3rd International Conference Speech Prosody (pp. 759–762). Dresden: TUDpress. Retrieved from http://www.isca-speech.org/archive/sp2006/papers/sp06_103.pdf
name: 096d8474-a2e5-5824-aff4-abebfffa905c
notes:
140 eri silbistruktuuriga 4-6 silbilist sõna. Salvestatud sõnaloendina 2 keelejuhilt ning raamlauses 6 Võru ja 7 Saaremaa keelejuhilt.
40 lühikeste lahtiste silpidega 5-6 silbilist sõna. Salvestatud raamlauses 6 ühiskeelselt keelejuhilt.

Materjali on kasutatud siin:
Pajusalu, K., Help, T., Lippus, P., Niit, E., Teras, P., & Viitso, T.-R. (2005). On the temporal structure of Estonian secondary-stressed feet. Linguistica Uralica, 41(2), 98–106.
Lippus, P., Pajusalu, K., & Teras, P. (2006). The Temporal Structure of Penta- and Hexasyllabic Words in Estonian. In R. Hoffmann & H. Mixdorff (Eds.), Proceedings of the 3rd International Conference Speech Prosody (pp. 759–762). Dresden: TUDpress. Retrieved from http://www.isca-speech.org/archive/sp2006/papers/sp06_103.pdf

A list of 140 words with 4-6 syllables with different syllable structure. Read by 2 speakers in word list and by 6 Võru dialect speakers and 7 Saaremaa dialect speakers in carrier sentences.
A list of 40 words with 5-6 syllables with short open syllables. Read by 6 Standard Estonian speakers in carrier sentences.

The data was collected for:
Pajusalu, K., Help, T., Lippus, P., Niit, E., Teras, P., & Viitso, T.-R. (2005). On the temporal structure of Estonian secondary-stressed feet. Linguistica Uralica, 41(2), 98–106.
Lippus, P., Pajusalu, K., & Teras, P. (2006). The Temporal Structure of Penta- and Hexasyllabic Words in Estonian. In R. Hoffmann & H. Mixdorff (Eds.), Proceedings of the 3rd International Conference Speech Prosody (pp. 759–762). Dresden: TUDpress. Retrieved from http://www.isca-speech.org/archive/sp2006/papers/sp06_103.pdf
title: Pikad sõnad
Long words in Estonian
